faqs.question: Is external audit mandatory for my company in Dubai?
faqs.answer: Yes, most companies in Dubai require external audits. All LLCs, branches of foreign companies, public and private joint stock companies, and most free zone entities must have their annual financial statements audited by a ministry-approved auditor. Some free zones have revenue thresholds below which audit is optional.

faqs.question: How long does an external audit take?
faqs.answer: A typical external audit takes 3-4 weeks from start to finish, depending on company size and record quality. We offer express services for urgent requirements, which can complete the audit in 2 weeks. The process involves planning (1 week), fieldwork (1-2 weeks), and reporting (1 week).

faqs.question: What documents do I need to provide?
faqs.answer: You'll need to provide financial statements, general ledger, bank statements, invoices, contracts, payroll records, tax filings, articles of association, and trade license. We provide a detailed checklist during the planning phase tailored to your business.

faqs.question: What is the difference between external and internal audit?
faqs.answer: External audit is an independent examination by third-party auditors required by law, focusing on financial statement accuracy. Internal audit is an ongoing evaluation of internal controls and risk management, typically performed by in-house or contracted auditors for management purposes.

faqs.question: Are you approved by the Ministry of Economy?
faqs.answer: Yes, Farahat & Co is fully approved by the UAE Ministry of Economy to conduct statutory audits. We are also recognized by DFSA, ADGM, and all major free zones across the UAE. Our auditors hold international certifications including CPA, CA, ACCA, and CIA.

faqs.question: Can you audit if my accounts are not up to date?
faqs.answer: Yes, we can help. We offer accounting cleanup services to bring your books up to date before the audit begins. This ensures a smooth audit process and may be more cost-effective than trying to audit incomplete records.

faqs.question: What happens if you find errors in my financial statements?
faqs.answer: If we identify material misstatements, we discuss them with management and provide opportunities to make adjustments. Most errors can be corrected before the final audit report. Our goal is to help you present accurate financial statements while maintaining audit independence.

faqs.question: Do you provide the audit report in Arabic?
faqs.answer: Yes, we provide audit reports in both English and Arabic to meet Ministry of Economy requirements. All financial statements and accompanying notes are translated by qualified professionals to ensure accuracy.

faqs.question: How much does an external audit cost?
faqs.answer: External audit fees typically range from AED 15,000 to AED 60,000+ depending on company size, complexity, and industry. Factors include annual revenue, number of locations, transaction volume, and timeline. We provide fixed-price quotes after an initial consultation.

faqs.question: When should I start my annual audit?
faqs.answer: Ideally, start your audit 2-3 months before your filing deadline. This allows time for proper planning, fieldwork, and any necessary adjustments. Many companies begin their audit immediately after year-end closing to ensure timely submission to the Ministry.

faqs.question: What is the difference between internal and external audit?
faqs.answer: External audit is an independent examination of financial statements required by law, focusing on accuracy and compliance. Internal audit is ongoing evaluation of operations, controls, and risks conducted for management purposes. External audit is mandatory; internal audit is voluntary but highly recommended for good governance.

faqs.question: Do I need an internal audit if I already have external audit?
faqs.answer: Yes, they serve different purposes. External audit validates financial statements once a year. Internal audit continuously monitors operations, identifies risks, and improves controls throughout the year. Many companies benefit from both - external audit for compliance, internal audit for risk management and operational improvement.

faqs.question: How often should internal audits be conducted?
faqs.answer: It depends on your risk profile and size. Many organizations conduct internal audits quarterly or semi-annually for high-risk areas, annually for medium-risk areas, and every 2-3 years for low-risk areas. We help develop a risk-based audit plan tailored to your needs.

faqs.question: Can you be our internal audit department?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer co-sourced and fully outsourced internal audit services. This is often more cost-effective than hiring full-time internal audit staff, while providing access to specialized expertise and industry best practices.

faqs.question: What areas can internal audit cover?
faqs.answer: Internal audit can cover any aspect of your business: financial controls, operational processes, IT systems, compliance, procurement, inventory management, sales, HR processes, fraud risk, and more. We tailor scope to your specific risk areas and priorities.

faqs.question: Is internal audit confidential?
faqs.answer: Yes, we maintain strict confidentiality. Internal audit findings are typically reported to senior management and the audit committee. We work collaboratively with management to address issues while maintaining independence and objectivity.

faqs.question: How long does an internal audit take?
faqs.answer: A typical process or department audit takes 3-6 weeks, depending on scope and complexity. Ongoing internal audit retainers involve continuous work throughout the year with regular reporting cycles.

faqs.question: Do you help with SOX compliance?
faqs.answer: Yes, we have extensive experience helping companies prepare for and maintain SOX compliance. Our internal control documentation, testing, and reporting meet SOX requirements. We can also assist with SOX 404 compliance.

faqs.question: What qualifications do your internal auditors have?
faqs.answer: Our internal audit team includes Certified Internal Auditors (CIA), Certified Fraud Examiners (CFE), CPAs, and ACCA professionals with deep industry experience across UAE sectors.

faqs.question: Can you audit our IT systems and cybersecurity controls?
faqs.answer: Yes, we have IT audit specialists who can assess IT general controls, cybersecurity measures, data privacy compliance, system access controls, and IT governance. We also coordinate with specialized IT security firms when needed.

faqs.question: How long does due diligence take?
faqs.answer: Typical due diligence engagements take 2-4 weeks, depending on company size and complexity. Simple acquisitions may complete in 2 weeks, while complex multi-entity transactions may require 4-6 weeks. Timeline is often driven by target company's cooperation and document availability.

faqs.question: What is the difference between financial and commercial due diligence?
faqs.answer: Financial due diligence examines historical financial performance, accounting quality, working capital, and financial projections. Commercial due diligence assesses market position, competitive landscape, customer relationships, growth drivers, and strategic fit. Both are often conducted together for comprehensive insight.

faqs.question: Can you help with cross-border transactions?
faqs.answer: Yes, we have experience with cross-border M&A and coordinate with our international network of accounting and legal advisors. We handle multi-jurisdiction due diligence, foreign exchange considerations, and international tax implications.

faqs.question: What is Quality of Earnings (QoE) analysis?
faqs.answer: Quality of Earnings analysis adjusts reported EBITDA or profits to reflect sustainable, recurring earnings. We identify one-time items, aggressive accounting, related party transactions, and other adjustments that affect true profitability - giving you accurate basis for valuation.

faqs.question: Do you provide a fairness opinion or valuation?
faqs.answer: We provide detailed financial analysis and can offer valuation insights as part of due diligence. For formal fairness opinions or independent business valuations, we offer separate valuation services in accordance with international standards.

faqs.question: What happens if you discover major red flags?
faqs.answer: We report all findings objectively, with risk ratings and quantification where possible. Major red flags are highlighted immediately through real-time communication. You can use findings to renegotiate terms, adjust price, require seller warranties, or walk away from the deal.

faqs.question: Can you do due diligence on startups with limited financial history?
faqs.answer: Yes, for startups and early-stage companies, we adapt our approach to focus on business model validation, revenue assumptions, cash burn analysis, cap table review, key contract assessment, and management team evaluation. We validate projections against market benchmarks.

faqs.question: Is due diligence confidential?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We sign NDAs and maintain strict confidentiality throughout the process. Our findings are shared only with you and your designated advisors. We understand the sensitive nature of M&A transactions.

faqs.question: What documents do you need to review?
faqs.answer: We typically review 3 years of financial statements, tax returns, management accounts, budgets/forecasts, contracts (customers, suppliers, leases), organizational documents, banking agreements, related party transactions, HR records, and IP documentation. We provide a detailed request list at engagement start.

faqs.question: Can you help after the deal closes?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer post-acquisition support including integration planning, 100-day reviews, synergy tracking, accounting policy harmonization, and post-close working capital adjustments. Many clients engage us for both pre- and post-transaction support.

Our RERA audit team has deep expertise in Dubai real estate regulations, escrow account compliance, and DLD submission requirements. We help you meet all regulatory obligations while identifying opportunities to improve financial management of your real estate operations.

faqs.question: What is a RERA audit?
faqs.answer: RERA audit is a specialized audit for Dubai real estate companies, focusing on compliance with Dubai Land Department regulations. It covers escrow account management for developers, service charge administration for property managers, and overall financial compliance with RERA requirements.

faqs.question: Who needs a RERA audit?
faqs.answer: Real estate developers with escrow accounts for off-plan projects, property management companies, owners associations, and master developers must have RERA audits. The audit must be conducted by DLD-approved auditors like Farahat & Co.

faqs.question: How is RERA audit different from external audit?
faqs.answer: RERA audit is specifically focused on real estate regulatory compliance and DLD requirements. It includes specialized procedures for escrow accounts, service charges, and real estate-specific regulations. External audit covers overall financial statements for all companies.

faqs.question: What is escrow account audit?
faqs.answer: Escrow account audit verifies that developer escrow accounts are properly managed according to DLD regulations - ensuring funds are used only for designated projects, proper records are maintained, and investor protection requirements are met.

faqs.question: How long does RERA audit take?
faqs.answer: A typical RERA audit takes 3-5 weeks depending on the number of properties, escrow accounts, and service charge pools. We work efficiently to meet DLD submission deadlines.

faqs.question: What documents are needed for RERA audit?
faqs.answer: You'll need escrow account statements, service charge records, property management agreements, RERA registration documents, bank statements, expenditure receipts, owners association minutes, and DLD correspondence. We provide a detailed checklist.

faqs.question: When is the RERA audit deadline?
faqs.answer: RERA audit deadlines vary based on your company's financial year-end and RERA registration requirements. Generally, audits must be submitted within 3-4 months of year-end. We help you track and meet your specific deadline.

faqs.question: Can you help with DLD submission?
faqs.answer: Yes, we prepare all audit reports in DLD-compliant format and can assist with electronic submission to Dubai Land Department. We ensure all required documentation is properly formatted and submitted on time.

faqs.question: What happens if I don't get RERA audit?
faqs.answer: Failure to complete required RERA audits can result in DLD penalties, suspension of escrow account access, inability to register new projects, and potential legal action. Compliance is mandatory for licensed real estate operators.

faqs.question: Do you audit service charges?
faqs.answer: Yes, we specialize in service charge audits for property managers and owners associations. We verify that service charges are collected properly, used only for designated purposes, and adequately disclosed to owners.

faqs.question: When should I consider a forensic audit?
faqs.answer: Consider forensic audit when you suspect fraud, embezzlement, or financial misconduct; when facing shareholder disputes; when preparing for litigation; when investigating whistleblower claims; or when required by insurance companies for fraud claims. Early investigation can prevent further losses.

faqs.question: How is forensic audit different from external audit?
faqs.answer: External audit examines financial statements for accuracy and compliance. Forensic audit specifically investigates suspected fraud with the goal of gathering legal evidence. Forensic auditors use investigative techniques, conduct interviews, and prepare litigation-ready documentation.

faqs.question: Is forensic audit confidential?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We maintain strict confidentiality throughout investigations. Results are shared only with you and your designated legal counsel. We understand the sensitive nature of fraud investigations and work discretely to protect your business reputation.

faqs.question: Can forensic audit findings be used in court?
faqs.answer: Yes, our forensic audit reports are prepared to legal standards and can be used as evidence in court proceedings. Our Certified Fraud Examiners can provide expert witness testimony if required. We coordinate closely with your legal team.

faqs.question: How long does a forensic investigation take?
faqs.answer: Simple investigations may take 2-3 weeks, while complex cases can require 2-3 months or longer. Timeline depends on the scope of suspected fraud, availability of records, need for interviews, and complexity of transactions being traced.

faqs.question: What is asset tracing?
faqs.answer: Asset tracing is the process of following the trail of misappropriated funds or assets to determine where they went. We use forensic accounting techniques, banking analysis, and investigative methods to locate funds and support recovery efforts.

faqs.question: Do you work with law enforcement?
faqs.answer: We can coordinate with law enforcement and regulatory authorities when appropriate and authorized by you. Our investigations can support criminal prosecutions, civil litigation, and regulatory proceedings.

faqs.question: Can you detect fraud before it is reported?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer proactive fraud risk assessments and fraud prevention programs. These identify control weaknesses and fraud risks before incidents occur. Prevention is always more cost-effective than investigation.

faqs.question: What qualifications do forensic auditors have?
faqs.answer: Our forensic team includes Certified Fraud Examiners (CFE), CPAs, and investigators with extensive fraud detection experience. We have successfully supported numerous legal cases and recovered millions in misappropriated funds.

faqs.question: How much does forensic audit cost?
faqs.answer: Forensic audit fees typically range from AED 30,000 to AED 150,000+ depending on case complexity. We provide cost estimates after initial consultation. Given the potential for asset recovery and loss prevention, forensic audit often provides substantial ROI.

Whether triggered by an FTA audit notice or conducted proactively for compliance assurance, VAT audits help identify and correct errors before they result in penalties.

The UAE's VAT system requires businesses to maintain detailed records, file accurate returns, and comply with specific rules around input tax recovery, exempt vs. taxable supplies, and cross-border transactions. Our VAT audit team has deep expertise in FTA regulations and industry-specific VAT challenges across real estate, trading, healthcare, and other sectors.

faqs.question: What triggers an FTA VAT audit?
faqs.answer: FTA may audit businesses based on risk indicators including frequent late filings, large refund claims, industry-specific patterns, inconsistent returns, or random selection. Proactive VAT audits help you prepare and identify issues before FTA scrutiny.

faqs.question: How long does a VAT audit take?
faqs.answer: A proactive VAT health check takes 1-2 weeks. Comprehensive VAT audits typically take 3-4 weeks. If you've received an FTA audit notice, timeline is often driven by FTA deadlines (usually 20 business days to respond).

faqs.question: What is voluntary disclosure and when should I use it?
faqs.answer: Voluntary disclosure is proactively reporting VAT errors to FTA before they discover them. If you identify VAT mistakes (under-reported output tax, over-claimed input tax), voluntary disclosure can reduce penalties from 50% to as low as 5% of the tax amount.

faqs.question: What are common VAT compliance mistakes?
faqs.answer: Common errors include incorrect VAT treatment of transactions, input tax claimed on exempt supplies, missing or incomplete tax invoices, late filings, errors in cross-border transaction treatment, and improper use of reverse charge mechanism.

faqs.question: Can you represent us during an FTA audit?
faqs.answer: Yes, we provide full FTA audit support including document preparation, response drafting, representation in FTA meetings, and penalty negotiation. Our expertise helps minimize exposure and resolve audits efficiently.

faqs.question: What documents do I need for VAT audit?
faqs.answer: You'll need VAT returns, general ledger, tax invoices (sales and purchases), import/export documentation, exemption certificates, credit/debit notes, adjustment records, and VAT account reconciliations. We provide a detailed checklist.

faqs.question: How much are FTA penalties for VAT violations?
faqs.answer: Penalties vary: AED 1,000-15,000 for administrative violations (late filing, no tax invoice), 50% of tax for late payment, 50% of tax difference for errors (reducible to 5-30% via voluntary disclosure), and up to 300% for tax evasion.

faqs.question: Do all businesses need VAT audit?
faqs.answer: VAT audit is not legally mandatory for all businesses (unlike financial statement audit). However, it's highly recommended if you receive FTA audit notice, have complex VAT scenarios, claim large refunds, or want proactive compliance assurance.

faqs.question: Can you help with VAT refund applications?
faqs.answer: Yes, we verify VAT refund claims for accuracy and supporting documentation before submission to FTA. This reduces rejection risk and ensures you can substantiate all input tax recovery claims if questioned.

faqs.question: What if we made VAT errors in previous years?
faqs.answer: If you discover historical VAT errors, we recommend immediate voluntary disclosure to FTA to minimize penalties. We help quantify the error, prepare disclosure documentation, and manage the submission process to achieve the best outcome.
